active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the statement: 'Direction and Planning can be skipped in mature organizations with automated threat hunting tools.' Use examples from MITRE ATT&CK and recent breaches (e.g., SolarWinds) to support arguments, addressing common misconceptions like 'Direction is optional' or 'Planning ignores iterative feedback.' Synthesize group consensus into key takeaways.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence. Topic Hierarchy: Level 1: Cybersecurity > Level 2: Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Level 3: Threat Actor Profiling > Level 4: 001_Threat Intelligence 003_Collection and Analysis > Level 5: 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle > Level 6: Direction and Planning Phase. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards optimized for spaced repetition (Anki-compatible). Cover all Bloom's levels via these objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives ARRAY HERE]. Use 4-layer scaffolding: [INSERT scaffolding OBJECT HERE]. Incorporate active learning hooks: [INSERT active_learning OBJECT HERE]. Content foundation: Direction (strategic 'what/why'), Planning (tactical 'how'). Frameworks: MITRE ATT&CK (tactics=why, techniques=how, sub-techniques/procedures=granular). Best practices: Define objectives, scope requirements, align stakeholders, allocate resources, select methodologies, prioritize risk, set metrics. Address misconceptions (e.g., phases optional). Voter priorities: Progressive complexity, measurable outcomes, engagement. Follow exact flashcard schema: [INSERT flashcard_schema OBJECT HERE]. Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'blooms_level': '...', 'scaffold_layer': '...', 'type': 'MCQ/ShortAnswer/Cloze'}]. Ensure progressive coverage: 30% Layer1, 25% Layer2, 25% Layer3, 20% Layer4. Balance Bloom's: 20% Remember/Understand, 30% Apply/Analyze, 30% Evaluate, 20% Create. Make engaging, web-grounded (cite CISA/MITRE).
